item.title: Tomb Garden of Q(uintius) Medicus
item.description: Province italia Location via tiburtina via tiburtina (Pleiades) Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Tomb Garden of Q(uintius) Medicus Keywords tombs Garden Description An opisthographic marble slab found reused for a Christian tomb (ICUR 8842) in the catacombs of S. Cyriaca on the Via Tiburtina records the epitaph of an imperial freedman, Q(uintius) Medicus, who some time during the first or second century built a tomb garden (cepotafiu(m)) for himself and granted possession of it to his daughter, Quinta Vitalis. Maps Plans Images Dates Unspecified Bibliography G.-L. Gregori, Horti sepulchrales e cepotaphia nelle iscrizioni urbane, Article : Italian, BCom 92 (1987-88) [1989] 182 n. 48. worldcat Pleiades ID 272213281 TGN ID Contributor Publication date
